description:
As an Analyst on the Staffing Strategy and Operations team, you’ll work closely with various teams to conduct action-oriented analyses and provide regular insights and reports on trends and performance. Typical projects for Analysts include applying statistical techniques to analyze organizational effectiveness, developing models to build our global resource planning model, or helping to define our technology roadmap. Above all else, you’ll use your expertise to help our organization make thoughtful, data-driven decisions.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience using quantitative and qualitative analytical strategies to generate insights, answer questions, and inform solutions.
  • Experience manipulating data to measure the effectiveness of programs, interventions, and efforts for an organization.
  • Experience working with spreadsheet software.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with SQL, Python, or R.
  • Ability to self-start and direct work in an unstructured environment.
  • Client service-oriented, with an emphasis on being diligent and using creative thinking skills.
  • Comfort dealing with ambiguity.
  • Excellent communications skills.
responsibilities:
• Work with company leadership to define, launch, and drive strategic organizational and operational initiatives around hiring.
  • Deliver quantitative analyses and advanced modeling that translates data into actionable insights.
  • Develop and automate data and analytics solutions.
  • Prioritize work to manage multiple workstreams, high-pressure situations, and new information.
  • Build and iterate dashboards to provide insights at scale.
title: Analyst, People Operations Strategy, Planning and Analysis
